title: What's better, Amity University or a college in Delhi University which isn't that reputed and clearly not of your choice? - Quora

response.answer_text: Firstly, think about the course that you want to get into. And not the college. In case you’re getting a college that provides you the course you want, but isn’t reputed, as you might feel, pls don’t let it bother you. Because in the long run, you wouldn’t want to do something you don’t like and enjoy. As far as DU is concerned, there are a few colleges, which are not that popular, but have come up with new campuses, with excellent infrastructure and labs. No matter which college you’re from , you get the same degree. Before jumping to a conclusion, discuss with your seniors, parents or elder siblings about the course that you intend to pursue. And then join the college, which suits your interest.

In this case, go for Amity. I am not saying this because I am a student at Amity University myself but because 2 years ago, I was in the same situation. I was getting DU colleges which were’t very reputed. When I visited their campus, to be very honest, it was bad. The buildings were not properly constructed, the place was very gloomy. Moreover I was not getting subject of my choice. At Amity, I got the subject I wanted to study. The campus is huge. The people are very active. There are almost all the facilities you can ask for. But the most important, they are very strict about studies. Also the faculty is good. I have presented my opinion. I hope the answer helps :)
